implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Provides the UI button for users to select a task and initiate editing. Calls the onEdit handler with the selected task.
implementation.name: TaskItem.onEdit
implementation.pseudo_code:
FOR each task displayed:
    SHOW 'Edit' button
    WHEN user clicks 'Edit':
        CALL onEdit(task)

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Displays a form pre-filled with the selected task's attributes, allowing users to modify title, description, priority, due date, or tag. On submit, calls onSubmit with updated values.
implementation.name: TaskForm
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF initialTask is provided:
    PREFILL form fields with initialTask values
    ALLOW user to edit title, description, priority, category, due date
    ON form submit:
        CALL onSubmit(updatedTaskData)

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Sends the updated task data to the backend via a PUT request to the /tasks/{id} endpoint.
implementation.name: api.updateTask
implementation.pseudo_code:
FUNCTION updateTask(id, taskData):
    SEND PUT request to /tasks/{id} with taskData
    IF response is OK:
        RETURN updated task
    ELSE:
        THROW error

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Receives the PUT request from the frontend, validates, and delegates to the database logic to update the task.
implementation.name: update_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
ENDPOINT PUT /tasks/{task_id}:
    CALL database.update_task(task_id, task)
    IF updated_task is None:
        RAISE 404 error
    RETURN updated_task

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Performs the actual update of the task in persistent storage, replacing the old task with the new data.
implementation.name: update_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
FUNCTION update_task(task_id, task_update):
    tasks = get_tasks()
    FOR each task in tasks:
        IF task.id == task_id:
            updated_task = Task(id=task_id, **task_update)
            REPLACE old task with updated_task
            save_tasks(tasks)
            RETURN updated_task
    RETURN None

missing_implementations: No UI for selecting a tag outside of the 'category' field (if 'tag' is meant to be a separate attribute distinct from 'category').

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: UI form for creating a new task, collects title, description, priority, due date, and tag (category) from the user and triggers submission.
implementation.name: TaskForm
implementation.pseudo_code:
Render a form with fields for:
  - Title (required)
  - Description
  - Priority (Low, Medium, High)
  - Category (Work, Personal, Study)
  - Due Date
On submit:
  IF all required fields are filled
    Call onSubmit with the entered data
  ELSE
    Prevent submission

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the form submission from TaskForm, calls the API to create a new task with all required fields.
implementation.name: handleCreateTask
implementation.pseudo_code:
When TaskForm is submitted:
  Call api.createTask with the task data
  IF successful
    Reload tasks list
    Close the form
  ELSE
    Show error

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Sends a POST request to the backend to create a new task, passing title, description, priority, due date, and category.
implementation.name: api.createTask
implementation.pseudo_code:
Send POST request to /tasks with JSON body:
  {
    title,
    description,
    priority,
    category,
    due_date,
    completed
  }
IF response is OK
  Return created task
ELSE
  Throw error

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: FastAPI endpoint that receives the POST request to /tasks, validates the input, and calls the database logic to store the new task.
implementation.name: create_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
On POST /tasks with TaskCreate payload:
  Call database.add_task(task)
  Return the created Task

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Creates a new Task object with all required fields, assigns a unique ID, saves it to the database (JSON file), and returns the new task.
implementation.name: add_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Create new Task with:
  id = uuid
  title, description, priority, category, due_date, completed from input
Append new Task to tasks list
Save tasks list to file
Return new Task

missing_implementations: Validation for required fields other than title is not enforced in backend (e.g., priority, due date, category/tag are optional, not required).
No backend-side validation for field formats (e.g., due date format, allowed priority/category values) beyond Pydantic defaults.
No explicit error handling for missing required fields except for title (handled by frontend required attribute).
